steps.instruction: Use the search bar to find the book by title, author, or category. Check if the book is available or already borrowed
View the book location (shelf location), you can find it under the book details
Go to the library and locate the book based on the shelf number/name and bring it to the circulation desk and follow the borrowing process
Keep the book in good condition and avoid damages and follow library rules regarding borrowing limits

faqs.question: How do I borrow a book?
faqs.answer: You can borrow a book by logging into your library account, search for the book and check availability before going to the library.

faqs.question: What is the borrowing period?
faqs.answer: Books can be borrowed for up to 14 days. If no one else has requested the book, you may renew it.

faqs.question: Can I access the library remotely?
faqs.answer: Yes! Our e-library is available 24/7. You can log in from any device with an internet connection.

faqs.question: How many books can I borrow at a time?
faqs.answer: Students can borrow up to 5 books at a time. Teachers and staff may have a higher borrowing limit.

faqs.question: How can I search for books in the library?
faqs.answer: Use the search bar on the library website to find books by title, author, or subject. Filters are available to refine your search.

faqs.question: Are there late fees for overdue books?
faqs.answer: Yes, overdue physical books may have a small late fee. However, e-books will return automatically, so no late fees apply.

faqs.question: What should I do if I lost a book?
faqs.answer: Report the lost book to the librarian as soon as possible. You may be asked to replace the book or pay a replacement fee.
